intro: Gonolobus boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals arranged in a trumpet shape. It produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds with silky hairs, aiding in wind dispersal.
